result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy J Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Defendant Billy J Daniels in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Billy J Daniels in custody.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 14CF33, 14CF217 and 14CF409

14CF409: Defense relates recommendation. PSI waived. Information filed. State requests the repeater be deleted from count 2. Court orders  the repeater to be deleted from count 2. Court dismisses count 1.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended count 2. Voters rights and felony admonitions given. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 

14CF33 & 14CF217 : PSI discussed. State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation. Defendant addresses the Court. Court relates and orders: 
SW - 3 years probation: 
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Costs plus DNA surcharge. 
14CF33: 34 days jail credit if revoked. Bond to be applied to costs. 
14CF217: 120 days jail.  111 days jail credit.


14CF409: 45 days jail consecutive to 14CF217.  0 days jail credit. Court grants good time. 
Costs plus DNA surcharge. 

Argument by Defense regarding Huber/work release. Argument by State. Court relates and does not grant Huber/work release.

Bond set.  
Preliminary hearing set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
To a $1000 signature bond with same condtions.

Must not possess any weapons.
